intro: Emilia sonchifolia var. javanica, commonly known as Java emilia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
